org.sd.xml.record
Class Record

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.xml.record.Record
Direct Known Subclasses:
Value
public class Record
extends java.lang.Object

Record abstraction holding attribute/value pairs, where each value can be another record or a string.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Nested Class Summary
static class Record.Field
          Container for a terminal attribute/value pair.
static class Record.View
          Definition of a view strategy over a record.

Constructor Detail

Record

public Record()
Create a new (empty) record.

Record

public Record(java.lang.String name)
Create a new (empty) record.

Note that currently a record as a value may only be used once.

Record

public Record(java.io.File xmlFile)
       throws java.io.IOException
Build a record from the xml tree, marking deep record nodes using a default html view.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

Record

public Record(Tree<XmlLite.Data> xmlTree)
Create a new record backed by the xml tree.

NOTE: The xmlTree's data must be an XmlLite.Tag or an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. This new instance will be associated with the tree's tag as its record.

Record

public Record(java.util.List<Tree<XmlLite.Data>> xmlTrees)
Create a new record with the given xmlTrees as its attributes.

Record

              java.util.List<Tree<XmlLite.Data>> xmlTrees)
Create a new record with the given xmlTrees as its attributes.

getRecord

public static final Record getRecord(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Get (or build) the record for just the given node.

If the node does not have a record and is not marked as a non-record, then create a record backed by the node.

asValue

public Value asValue()
Safely downcast this record to a value if it is one.

Note that as a record, this will never be a value and null will always be returned.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Get the name (type) of this record.

Note that if this record is a value, the name will be empty.

setName

public void setName(java.lang.String name)
Set this record's name, leaving the tag name unchanged.

setView

public void setView(Record.View view)
Set the view strategy for this record's view name.

Each view is either an attribute on this record's tag whose value will become the view or empty to indicate the tag name or null to indicate the record name. The record name will always be the final fallback in the strategy and need not be explicitly specified in the view.

getViewName

public java.lang.String getViewName()
Get this record's view name.

Note that this is computed using the view by getting the value on this record's tag for each view attribute until a non-null value is found. An empty view identifies the tag name (or text text) and a null view identifies the record name, which will always be the last "fallback" for a view name whether explicitly indicated or not.

setTagName

public void setTagName(java.lang.String name)
Change the tag name for this record, leaving the name unchanged.

public void setSibId(int sibId)
Set this record's sibling id.

Get this record's sibling id.

addValue

public void addValue(java.lang.String attribute,
                     java.lang.String data)
Add the given (terminal) data to this record associated with the given (simple) attribute.

Note that any attribute can have multiple values associated with it.

addValue

public void addValue(Record record)
Add the given record to this record associated with its name as the relational (simple) attribute.

Note that any attribute can have multiple values associated with it.

addValue

public void addValue(Value value)
Add the given value to this record associated with its name as the relational (simple) attribute.

Note that any attribute can have multiple values associated with it.

getValue

public Record getValue(java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method to get this record's (first) value for the given (simple or complex) tag name attribute.

Note that this gets the first child of the child named "attribute", which is a "grandchild". To just get the child with the given attribute as its name, use getRecord(attribute).

getValues

public java.util.List<Record> getValues(java.lang.String attribute)
Get this record's values for the given (simple or complex) tag name attribute.

Note that this gets the children of the child named "attribute", which are "grandchildren". To just get the children with the given attribute as their name, use getRecords(attribute).

getRecord

public Record getRecord(java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method to get this record's (first) record with the given (simple or complex) attribute name.

Note that this gets the first child named "attribute" as a record.

getRecords

public java.util.List<Record> getRecords(java.lang.String attribute)
Get this record's child records with the given (simple or complex) tag (attribute) name.

Note that this gets the children named "attribute" as records.

getSimpleAttributes

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSimpleAttributes()
Get this record's simple (immediate, local) attributes (tag names).

getFields

public java.util.List<Record.Field> getFields()
Get this record's instantiated (simple and complex) tag name attributes with their values (where these attribute/value combinations are also referred to as fields.)

Note that this yields attributes suitable for the getValue methods.

getViewFields

public java.util.List<Record.Field> getViewFields()
Get this record's instantiated (simple and complex) attributes with their values (where these attribute/value combinations are also referred to as fields) using this instance's current view.

Note that this does not necessarily yield attributes suitable for the getValue methods.

getFields

public final java.util.List<Record.Field> getFields(Record.View view)
Get the fields using the given view.

getAttribute

public java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String attribute)
Get the attribute off the record (if it exists).

minPathIndex

public final int minPathIndex()
Get the minimum path index of fields covered by this record.

maxPathIndex

public final int maxPathIndex()
Get the maximum path index of fields covered by this record.

getValueString

public java.lang.String getValueString(java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method to get this record's (first) value string for the given (simple or complex) tag name attribute.

Returns:
the value string or null if the attribute's value is not instantiated, not a record, or not present.

getValueStrings

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getValueStrings(java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method to get this record's (non-empty) value strings for the given (simple or complex) tag name attribute.

Returns:
the value strings or null if the attribute's values are not instantiated, not records, or not present.

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
Get all of this record's text.

All fields' text will be concatenated with a space.

getText

public java.lang.String getText(java.util.Properties properties,
                                java.lang.String defaultText)
Get all of this record's text.

All fields' text will be concatenated with a space.

If the text is null, then use the "property" attribute on the record to retrieve the property to use to get the text from properties. If the property is also missing, fallback to defaultText.

hasTree

public boolean hasTree()
Determine whether this record already has a(n xml)Tree.

Note that asTree will build one if it doesn't exist yet for this record. This method is a way to check whether the tree has been built yet without forcing it to build.

asTree

public Tree<XmlLite.Data> asTree()
Get this record as a tree.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

getXPathApplicator

public XPathApplicator getXPathApplicator()
Get this record's XPathApplicator.
